thread.section_title: Technology | Top News Page | AJC | www.ajc.com
thread.title: NEWSMAKERS

author: Bill Hendrick
title: NEWSMAKERS
text:
People moving up and around in the metro business community:
Atlanta-based national fitness club franchise Workout Anytime has added Mark de Gorter as chief operating officer and Greg Maurer to its personal training design team.
Kilpatrick Townsend & Stockton partner Ty Lord was recently elected to the board of directors of the Georgia Justice Project.
Dr. Kevin E. Woods has joined Cancer Treatment Centers of America as chief, interventional endoscopy, gastroenterology and nutrition
Quantum National Bank has named Ryan Lewis as vice president, SBA lender.
Deluxe Creative Services has named Jaclyn Paris as executive producer for its Atlanta facility.
Steve Fisher has been named president and chief executive officer of Atlanta-based Novelis.
Atlanta-based Hotel Equities has promoted Elizabeth Derby to vice president of talent and performance excellence.
The law firm of Chamberlain, Hrdlicka, White, Williams & Aughtry has added Samuel H. Grier and Joan M. McCallum as Atlanta-based associates
Spend Management Experts, an Atlanta-based leading transportation spend management consultancy, has named Brian Broadhurst vice president of transportation solutions and Gary Colangelo vice president of client services.
Engel & Völkers Buckhead Atlanta has named Brent Hill a real estate advisor.
Scott Johnson has been named membership director and board member of the National Association of Professional Organizers - Georgia Chapter. Linda Diamond has been named marketing director and board member, Kristin Diver vice president-elect and board member.
Peter J. Stewart has been named resident, Americas for Cyviz, a high-end technology company that develops ultra high-resolution video display and advanced collaboration systems.
GreenPrint LLC has added Scot Crawford as chief financial officer and Megan McCamey as senior vice president of social enterprise and sustainability.
Yancey Bros. Co., the nation’s oldest Caterpillar dealer, has appointed Trey Googe as president and chief operating officer.
